In a similar experiment, students are given a different platform of unknown rotational inertia. There is negligible friction in the axle of the platform. The students have lumps of clay of varying masses. In each trial, they measure the initial rotational speed of the platform and then drop a piece of clay at the very edge of the platform. The students then record the final angular speed of the platform. The following data table shows the measured values of the initial and final rotational speeds of the platform.
